channel.title: Starting up a computer tech business
channel.description:
Ok, im running out of money fast, and have no interest in pimping myself out again. So im starting my own computer tech business.
The aim would be to provide people with homecalls to fix up there comps, be it virus problems, dirty computer boxes, broken shit, etc.
Im not completly a computer nerd though, just a little bit. So im calling on the community to see if i can get a better list of things i would be expected to know in order to make this a worthwhile venture.
The services i can think of offering are: Virus Scans Computer Cleaning Networking Part installation Computer Tutorials for beginners
Anything else i should learn or add to the list? Ill be charging a 20min rate of something around $10 - $15 every 20 mins. Call out fee is the equiv of the first 20 mins, but then the first 20mins is free.

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Lets just say he can install various operating systems for different customers.

Read full topic

@supamagier wrote:

Kubuntu > Ubuntu > Windows ?

item.source: Starting up a computer tech business

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Disk defragment, backups, formatting and OS installation, virtually all types of diagnostics, software patching.

Odds are that you’d make the majority of your money from doing format and reinstalls, software patching and virus/spyware cleaning.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting up a computer tech business

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Well, if you were looking for computer nerds you are at the right place.

item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

haha bout time you recognised me

ide forgotten this forum even existed, lol. was on msn talkin to kane, and asked him to link me a computer nerd forum so i could start this thread

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Perhaps be able to set up high speed internet and/or secure wireless networks? That kind of stuff is rather simple yet brings a good price.

Offtopic: didn’t realize who you were at first, haven’t seen you for over 2 years, nice to see you back.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

hmm ok then.

really lookin for a list like the one i had in the first post, just a more educated one, so i can have things to aim for that i need to master.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:10, topic:236791”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=312576.msg2490751#msg2490751 date=1224103736]

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312576.msg2490602#msg2490602 date=1224099262]

Install Kubuntu for people.

Or that may hurt your business because they won’t have problems again…
[/quote]Lol, I hope you’re kidding. You think people that can barely get windows to work will be able to get a linux distro to work? Lol.

Lol, I hope you’re kidding. You think Kubuntu is hard to get around and work with? Lol.
[/quote]I know it’s one of the easiest distros to use, but I know people that still have problems doing things with Kubuntu.[/quote]

The kind of people who hire someone to work on their computer only turn it on, access firefox, and turn it back off anyway. Which is the same as windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

To expand on that: you could buy a wireless router, charge them for it, then set it up for them on the required computers, which I would charge a flat rate $15-20 or so.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

Offer to connect them to internet for only $14.00-$20.00, they can supply information needed and you can make the delivery and registration and phone calls.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Just thought I’d mention to have an hourly rate instead. However what you could do is simply charge a more expensive rate for 20 minutes, and make it slightly a deal if you’re there for an hour.

E.g:
20 minutes - $10
1 hour - $25

Seems like a good idea though, my friend’s dad does the same thing and makes a hell of a penny, but not to mention he also makes and runs websites for people, so that might be something to consider.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting up a computer tech business

item.title: Starting up a computer tech business
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

My cuz did what you are doing, and ill tell you now that there is a lot of money in it. he made first year profits, doing more or less the same thing.

i’ll e-mail him and see what advice he has to offer

Read full topic
